heisig_chinese_memo: To sing one must learn to sustain notes for a long time which can seem like the singer keeping their mouth open for 2 consecutive days.
heisig_constituent: chant, mouth, prosperous, sun, day, tongue wagging, sun2, day2, tongue wagging2
heisig_story: This one is easy! You have one mouth making no noise (the choirmaster) and two mouths with wagging tongues (the minimum for a chorus). So think of the key word, chant, as monastery singing and the kanji is yours forever (see frame 11).
koohiiStory1: Someone chanting with their mouth open for two consecutive days.
koohiiStory2: Chants from our mouths are meant to reach the sun and the stars. Stars are just suns just further away so they seem smaller.
jp_example_words:
åˆå”±(ãŒã£ã—ã‚‡ã†): chorus, singing in a chorus
å”±ãˆã‚‹(ã¨ãªãˆã‚‹): to recite, to chant, to call upon
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: It's time to do the mouth sun sun chant. That's when you use your mouth to chant sun sun, sun sun, sun sun, over and over until the sun appears.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Open your mouth and practice the chant right now! Sun sun, sun sun, sun sun!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You're doing this chant because the Shougun (ã—ã‚‡ã†) ordered you to. The sun hasn't been shining on him as much lately, and he's displeased. So now you have to chant for him.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The Shougun is glaring intently at you as you chant. Open your mouth as wide as you can, get all those "sun suns" out, and pray that the sun will appear.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the prosperous (æ˜Œ) mouth (å£) chants
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To sing one must learn to sustain notes for a long time which can seem like the singer keeping their mouth open for 2 consecutive days.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " mouth ", " chang " sound, the original meaning is to lead singing and leading music. "Shuowen": "Guide. From the mouth, prosperous." "Han Feizi. Jie Lao": "The yongye is also the elder of the five tones. Therefore, when the first is the first, the bell and the bell are followed, and the sing is the music. with."

" Sing " can mean advocacy, initiation, and later " advocacy ." "Wen Ziâ€§ Dao Yuan": "So the weak are the ones who live, the strong are the ones who die, the first to sing the poor road, and the latter to reach the original."

" Sing " can also express praise. "The Book of the Later Han DynastyÂ·The Legend of the ScholarsÂ·Kong Xi": "Qi Huan proclaimed his first emperor's evil in order to sing Guanzhong, and then the officials would do their best."

After " singing ", it often means singing. Tang Wangbo's "Farewell Preface to Tengwang Pavilion of Denghong Mansion in Autumn": "The fishing boat sings late, and the sound of the poor Pengli coast; the geese are frightened, and the sound cuts off the Hengyang Pu." Tong Da>: "If you don't sing Yuefu, who knows how to blame the deep autumn?"

Shouting and shouting can also be called " singing ." "Northern History-Sun Xiuyi Biography": "Ju (Gao Ju) speaks insultingly, and Xiuyi leads him to the left and right, and Ju speaks to the public as a thief."

" Sing " can also be used as a noun, which means the name of a tune and lyrics. "Book of Jinâ€§ Hermit Biographyâ€§ Xia Tong": "Wu Zixu admonished King Wu, but he couldn't help but threw himself into the sea.
humanum_short_description_en: From the " mouth ", " chang " sound, the original meaning is to lead singing and leading music.

sing
Basic explanation of words
sing
chÃ ng
Sound according to the law of music (yu?): singing. Aria. aria. Singing. Sing harmony (h?). singing.
Shouting, shouting: roll call. Sing and close.
Song: Sing a song.
Gu Tong "advocated" and advocated.
name.
sing
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ]ï¼»chÃ ngï¼½
["Guangyun" ruler is bright and cut, go to Yang, Chang. ]
Also known as "èª¯1".
(1) Lead singing; lead performance.
(2) Advocate; initiate. Later called "advocate".
(3) Singing; chanting.
(4) It is said that animals tweet.
(5) Praise; praise.
(6) Shouting, shouting.
(7) Especially refer to singing ticket, roll call.
(8) Threatening; publicizing.
(9) Names of ancient poetry styles.
(10) Poetry creation. See "Sure Sing".
(11) Melody; lyrics.
(12) Really, exactly. Also make smooth.
sing

[Jade articles] The Book of Rites says: One sing and three sighs. â—‹Advocate according to the current version of "Le Ji".ã€€[Guangyun] Send a song again. [Guang Yun] also made a counterpoint. [Ji Yun] also make prosperous.
sing
Source glyph
sing
Name meaning
: To make a sound, also say loudly, loudly; also refers to a song.

â™« Ğ¾Ğ¿ÑƒÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ² Ñ‚ÑƒĞ´Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ€Ñ‘ÑˆĞºÑƒ (4-Ğ¹ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ½).

Radicals: å£, æ—¥  (mouth, sun)
Meaning Mnemonic
It's time to do the mouth sun sun chant. That's when you use your mouth to chant sun sun, sun sun, sun sun, over and over until the sun appears.
Open your mouth and practice the chant right now! Sun sun, sun sun, sun sun!
Reading Mnemonic
You're doing this chant because the Shougun (ã—ã‚‡ã†) ordered you to. The sun hasn't been shining on him as much lately, and he's displeased. So now you have to chant for him.
The Shougun is glaring intently at you as you chant. Open your mouth as wide as you can, get all those "sun suns" out, and pray that the sun will appear.
